opennlp.ccg.alignment
Class IdentifiedPhraseReader

java.lang.Object
  java.io.Reader
      java.io.BufferedReader
          java.io.LineNumberReader
              opennlp.ccg.alignment.PhraseReader
                  opennlp.ccg.alignment.IdentifiedPhraseReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, Readable
public class IdentifiedPhraseReader
extends PhraseReader

Phrase reader for phrases that have an identifier in addition to a line number, usually formatted by markup like 

 <s snum="157"> ... </s>
Since the value of the identifier is not necessarily an Integer, this class gives IDs as strings. The phrase identifier attribute (here snum) and phrase tag (here s) are configurable when instances are constructed.

Author:
Scott Martin
See Also:
Alignments.DEFAULT_PHRASE_TAG, Alignments.DEFAULT_PHRASE_IDENTIFIER_ATTRIBUTE

IdentifiedPhraseReader

public IdentifiedPhraseReader(Reader in,
                              IndexBase numberBase,
                              String phraseTag,
                              String phraseIdentifierAttribute)
Creates an identified phrase reader for the specified phrase tag and identifier attribute.

Parameters:
phraseTag - The phrase tag that will be used to parse identifiers.
phraseIdentifierAttribute - The attribute that will denote identifiers when parsing phrases.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if phraseIdentifierAttribute or phraseTag is null.

readPhrase

public Phrase readPhrase()
                  throws IOException
Reads a phrase from the underlying input stream, first parsing the phrase's number based on the phrase tag and identifier attribute being used.

Overrides:
readPhrase in class PhraseReader
Returns:
A phrase with the ID signaled in the input.
Throws:
IOException - If the underlying input contains ill-formated phrase markup, or if no ID cannot be determined after parsing the phrase markup.
